poem:
"Flushed with Greed"

The loo of gold, missing from the stately hold,
Once sat grandly in an art show bold.
Stolen from Churchill's birthplace, so dignified,
By a thief whose audacious guilt couldn't hide.
In art's sordid underbelly, the tale unwinds,
Of a lavatory heist that boggles minds.
Oh how victory's flush now seems so bleak,
For James – a flush four-point-eight million pounds deep.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
